ygData.subject: Re: [eqbards] Kunark songs and stuff
ygData.msgSnippet: If I m understand your message, you are asking where the Knight is? :).  Hehe, wish we knew!  Nice train!  As Damaun, another level 51 bard who got wiped out
ygData.messageBody:
If I'm understand your message, you are asking where the Knight is? :). Hehe, wish we knew! Nice
train! As Damaun, another level 51 bard who got wiped out by the same train (summoned as he ran for
zone) shouted "Kudos to the puller that managed to pull a Mob that summons to zone and live!".

We had a discussion last night about the trains in Karnor's. Our belief is that most level 50's grew up
in overcrowded dungeons where the fine art of a good pull was not necessary and as a result most don't
know dirt about pulling successfully.

As for deeper, we're now discovering a couple of "safe" spots you can go to to get out of train city for
the most part including the castle wall where the lookouts spawn, the little alcove just inside the
castle to the left, the captain's area to the right up the ramp and the two corners by the lake. Problem
is that all of these areas can be a challenge to hold, but certainly doable with a single group.
Whatever you do, don't swim in the under water tunnel to the right of the castle... Insta-death or
insta-train (if somehow you manage to make it that far).


Sylly Songsynger wrote:

> Excuse my ignorance, where is this guy? Sorry, I have been woefully
> neglecting and studiously avoiding Karnor's Castle - train city as the
> morons from our server have moved in from Sol-B. Last night we were camping
> one side of the front zone and another group was at the other side. They
> over pulled and we watched 6 or more mobs swarm them. They zone and we
> watch the train begin to reset. Then this one solo moron fire up her jboots
> and dashes over to have a look see or something. well, she comes running
> back with the train and we all have to zone. /rude followed by soanso says,
> "Why rude? I didn't pull that train on you. I was just waiting to meet my
> group..." Until I get with my guild in a couple decent groups who can go
> deep and get out of train range (if that is even possible), I have no
> interest in that place.
>
> Sylly
>
> ----- Original Message -----
> From: "Jeff Illian" <jeff@...>
> To: <eqbards@egroups.com>
> Sent: Wednesday, May 03, 2000 1:11 PM
> Subject: Re: [eqbards] Kunark songs and stuff
>
> > The level 51 bard barely got resisted by the Knight where as I started
> > with 8 in a row (I almost never get resisted...). Don't know for sure
> > if the resists were level dependent or if it was because of the
> > infamous Verant semi-random number generator.
> >
> > On an interesting side note, I resisted 2 gravity fluxes that
> > encounter as well... looks like our cleric took one at full force
> > though. I had thought we had a well balanced party (level 51 Troll
> > warrior, Level 51 Paladin, Level 51 bard, Level 51 druid, Level 51
> > cleric and me, level 50 bard) but we got literally ripped to shreads
> > incredibly fast.
>
